oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Single-crystal to single-crystal transformations in discrete hydrated dimeric copper complexes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MOBIN, SM
SRIVASTAVA, AK
MATHUR, P
LAHIRI, GK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: metal-organic framework
photochemical 2+2 cycloaddition
coordination polymer
solid-state
structural transformation
magnetic-properties
1st example
network
dehydration
conversions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The single crystals of discrete hydrated [(OAc)Cu(mu-hep)(2)Cu(OAc)]center dot 2H(2)O (1 center dot 2H(2)O) and [(OAc)Cu(mu-hep)(2)Cu(O(n)Pr)]center dot 2H(2)O (2 center dot 2H(2)O) (the lattice H(2)O molecules exist as a tetrameric water cluster, hep-H = 2-(2-hydroxyethyl)-pyridine), OAc(-) = acetate and O(n)Pr(-) = n-propionate) undergo single-crystal to single-crystal (SCSC) transformations to the dehydrated 1 and 2, respectively, under the influence of heat. The reverse SCSC processes of 1/2-->1 center dot 2H(2)O/2 center dot 2H(2)O involving the regeneration of the lattice water tetramers take place on exposure of 1/2 to water vapour. However, the blue single crystal of discrete hydrated [(O(n)Pr)Cu(mu-hep)(2)Cu(O(n)Pr)]center dot 2H(2)O (3 center dot 2H(2)O), incorporating the two bulkier OnPr-terminal bidentate ligands, irreversibly converts to the green single crystal of a unique discrete tetrameric [Cu(4)(mu(3)hep)(2)(mu-hep)(2)(mu-O(n)Pr)(2)(O(n)Pr)(2)] (4) with double open cubane core either by heating or by a simple vapour diffusion technique via the breaking and forming of multiple covalent bonds.
